definition: switchboard operator/phone operator
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: A:Operator?I want to make a call back to China.
sentences.chinese: 接線生嗎？我想打電話回中國。

sentences.english: Operator, I'd like to call Taibei, please. Station-to-station.
sentences.chinese: 接線生，我要打到臺北的叫號電話。

sentences.english: I'm afraid all calls to guest room must go through the operator.
sentences.chinese: 對不起，所有打到客房的電話都要通過我們接線生轉。

sentences.english: Yes, operator. I'm trying to call New-York.
sentences.chinese: 是，接線生，我要打到紐約。

sentences.english: The operator told me to hang up and dial the same number again.
sentences.chinese: 接線生叫我掛斷電話再撥同一號碼。

sentences.english: Operator, do I have to wait a long time?
sentences.chinese: 接線生，我需要等很久嗎？

sentences.english: On all these vessels there is a radio officer handling messages.
sentences.chinese: 所有的船上都有一個無線電接線生負責收發訊息。

sentences.english: I'd like to talk to Director Chen.
sentences.chinese: 接線生，我想與陳主任談話。

definition: to judge between right and wrong/to reason things out
to heave a sigh of relief
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
scene of the crime
statement of account
family scandal/skeleton in the closet
to undress
product placement
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
improvisation
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
villains collude together (idiom); to work hand in glove with sb (to nefarious ends)
(airport) check-in/boarding formalities
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to advertise/to solicit business
